title: Scoot: Donald Trump, the Bible salesman - you're kidding, right?
text:
By Scoot ,
11 hours ago
It’s Easter Week and salvation is at hand!
Businessman turned politician turned Bible salesman, Donald Trump is hawking a $60 Bible he is calling the “God Bless The U.S.A. Bible” that is “For Your Soul.” The idea of Donald Trump as a Bible salesman is laughable.
We all know that Donald Trump desperately needs money, in spite of his countless proclamations about how he is mega rich. In a video released this week, Trump announced he was selling the “God Bless The U.S.A. Bible and talked about how “very important” it is to him. Trump acted like a televangelist when he said, “You have to have it for your heart, for your soul.” “Religion and Christianity are the biggest things missing from this country,” Trump continued. Trump declared the Bible to be his favorite book.
Is it even believable that Donald Trump, of all people, holds the Bible as his favorite book?
In the years since he began running for president, Donald Trump has been awkwardly inarticulate in the things he has said about the Bible. During a speech at Liberty University in 2016, Trump began talking about “Two Corinthians 3:17” instead of the correct reference of “Second Corinthians 3:17.” Trump read the verse: “Where the Spirit of the Lord, right? There is liberty.” “And here there is Liberty college, but, Liberty University, but it is so true.” What???
In an interview in 2015, Donald Trump was asked what was his favorite Bible verse and he said he “didn’t want to go into specifics.” Have you ever known anyone who claims to revere the Bible and its significance that did not have a favorite verse? No! Literally, anyone who claims to appreciate the attributes of the Bible can immediately recite several favorite Bible verses. But not Donald Trump.
I understand that no one really knows what lives in another person’s heart, but we all know that words are cheap. It’s easy for anyone to say anything, but it is difficult to live up to the words one speaks. Let’s take a look at Donald Trump’s words and his behavior and compare them to his claim that the Bible is his favorite book.
Trump lied and falsified medical records to keep from being drafted during the Vietnam War.
Trump has expressed love and respect for dictators, enemies of the United States.
Trump was banging a porn star while his wife, Melania was pregnant with their son Barron
Trump also had sex with a Playboy Playmate while married to Melania.
Trump paid money to his mistresses to cover up his adulterous affairs.
Trump ran a fraudulent university and was forced to settle a $25 million class action lawsuit against Trump University.
Trump lost 38 lawsuits relating to breaking contracts, defamation, and sexual harassment cases.
Trump became famous for his misogynistic and racist comments about women and racial minorities.
Trump went on for some time refusing to denounce white supremacist groups and even referred to some white supremacists as “very fine people.”
Trump hid tax returns and lied about his handling of classified documents determined to have been illegally removed from the White House.
Trump was ordered to pay $5 million to E. Jean Carroll, the woman he was found liable for sexually assaulting and because of his degrading comments about Carroll was ordered to pay $88.3 million.
Upon seeing an actress, Trump said, “I just start kissing them. It’s like a magnet. Just kiss. I don’t even wait.”
Trump said, “And when you’re a star, they let you do it. You can do anything. Grab em by the p***y. You can do anything.”
Trump once spoke of how attractive his daughter, Ivanka, was and suggested if she were not his daughter he might want to date her.
Trump is currently facing indictments and an upcoming criminal trial.
And last but not least - Trump cheats at golf!
The aforementioned words and actions of Donald Trump do not include all of the blatant examples of Trump’s defiance of his “favorite book.”
In America, we all have the right to vote for the candidate of our choice, but this blog is not about voting choices. This blog is about Donald Trump - the man - and how laughable it is that he is selling the Bible and using God to suck money from the weak and gullible.
BTW: On Amazon.com, the King James version of the Bible is selling for $18.83.
